skill.name: web-artifacts-builder
skill.description: Suite of tools for creating elaborate, multi-component claude.ai HTML artifacts using modern frontend web technologies (React, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui). Use for complex artifacts requiring state management, routing, or shadcn/ui components - not for simple single-file HTML/JSX artifacts.

security_audit.summary: This skill contains shell scripts for initializing and bundling React projects. The scripts create new project directories and install standard frontend dependencies via pnpm. All operations are confined to user-specified project directories with no network exfiltration or credential access.

low_findings.title: Shell scripts execute external package managers
low_findings.description: The scripts use pnpm to install npm packages. An attacker with control over package registries could theoretically supply malicious packages. The scripts run `pnpm add -D parcel @parcel/config-default parcel-resolver-tspaths html-inline` (bundle-artifact.sh:21) and similar commands in init-artifact.sh. This is standard practice for build tools but represents supply chain exposure.

content.value_statement: Creating complex HTML artifacts with React requires significant setup time and configuration. This skill provides automated scripts to initialize React projects with Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui, then bundle everything into a single portable HTML file ready to share in Claude conversations.
actual_capabilities: Initialize new React + Vite projects with TypeScript support
Configure Tailwind CSS 3.4 with shadcn/ui theming system
Bundle React apps into single portable HTML files
Set up path aliases and development configuration
Create self-contained artifacts for Claude conversations
limitations: Requires Node.js 18 or higher to run
Creates new project directories outside the skill folder
Does not provide pre-built artifact templates

best_practices: Initialize projects in dedicated directories to keep artifacts organized
Test the bundled HTML in a browser before sharing
Use the shadcn/ui component library for consistent, accessible UI elements
anti_patterns: Avoid sharing unbundled source code as artifacts
Do not include sensitive configuration or credentials in artifacts
Avoid excessive dependencies that increase bundle size significantly

faq.question: What tools do I need installed first?
faq.answer: You need Node.js 18+ and pnpm installed before using this skill.

faq.question: What is the maximum bundle size?
faq.answer: There is no strict limit but larger bundles load slower. Keep artifacts under 1MB when possible.

faq.question: Can I use this with other AI assistants?
faq.answer: Yes, the scripts work independently of Claude. Generate the HTML file then share it anywhere.

faq.question: Is my data safe when bundling?
faq.answer: Bundling only includes files in your project directory. No external data is accessed.

faq.question: Why is my bundle failing to build?
faq.answer: Check that you have an index.html in your project root and all dependencies are installed via pnpm.

faq.question: How does this differ from simple HTML artifacts?
faq.answer: This skill enables complex React apps with state management, routing, and 40+ UI components.
